html.HtmlService.name: HtmlService
html.HtmlService.doc: Service for returning HTML and other text content from a script.

property.name: SandboxMode
property.doc: An enum representing the sandbox modes that can be used for client-side HtmlService scripts.

property.name: XFrameOptionsMode
property.doc: An enum representing the X-Frame-Options modes that can be used for client-side HtmlService scripts.

method.name: createHtmlOutput
method.doc: Creates a new HtmlOutput object that can be returned from the script.

method.name: createHtmlOutput
method.doc: Creates a new HtmlOutput object from a BlobSource resource.

argument.name: blob
argument.doc: the object to get HTML out of

method.name: createHtmlOutput
method.doc: Creates a new HtmlOutput object that can be returned from the script.

method.name: createHtmlOutputFromFile
method.doc: Creates a new HtmlOutput object from a file in the code editor.

argument.name: filename
argument.doc: the name of the file to use

method.name: createTemplate
method.doc: Creates a new HtmlTemplate object from a BlobSource resource.

argument.name: blob
argument.doc: The object to get HTML out of.

method.name: createTemplate
method.doc: Creates a new HtmlTemplate object that can be returned from the script.

method.name: createTemplateFromFile
method.doc: Creates a new HtmlTemplate object from a file in the code editor.

argument.name: filename
argument.doc: the name of the file to use

method.name: getUserAgent
method.doc: Gets the user-agent string for the current browser.

html.HtmlOutput.name: HtmlOutput
html.HtmlOutput.doc: An HtmlOutput object that can be served from a script. Due to security considerations, scripts cannot directly return HTML to a browser. Instead, they must sanitize it so that it cannot perform malicious actions. You can return sanitized HTML like this:

method.name: addMetaTag
method.doc: Adds a meta tag to the page.

argument.name: name
argument.doc: the value of the meta tag's name attribute

argument.name: content
argument.doc: the value of the meta tag's content attribute

method.name: append
method.doc: Appends new content to the content of this HtmlOutput.

method.name: appendUntrusted
method.doc: Appends new content to the content of this HtmlOutput, using contextual escaping.

method.name: asTemplate
method.doc: Returns an HtmlTemplate backed by this HtmlOutput.

method.name: clear
method.doc: Clears the current content.

method.name: getAs
method.doc: Return the data inside this object as a blob converted to the specified content type.

argument.name: contentType
argument.doc: the MIME type to convert to. For most blobs, 'application/pdf' is the only valid option. For images in BMP, GIF, JPEG, or PNG format, any of 'image/bmp', 'image/gif', 'image/jpeg', or 'image/png' are also valid.

method.name: getBlob
method.doc: Return the data inside this object as a blob.

method.name: getContent
method.doc: Gets the content of this HtmlOutput.

method.name: getFaviconUrl
method.doc: Gets the URL for a favicon link tag added to the page by calling setFaviconUrl(iconUrl).

method.name: getHeight
method.doc: Gets the initial height of the custom dialog in Google Docs, Sheets, or Forms.

method.name: getMetaTags
method.doc: Gets an array of objects that represent meta tags added to the page by calling addMetaTag(name, content).

method.name: getTitle
method.doc: Gets the title of the output page.

method.name: getWidth
method.doc: Gets the initial width of the custom dialog in Google Docs, Sheets, or Forms.

method.name: setContent
method.doc: Sets the content of this HtmlOutput.

method.name: setFaviconUrl
method.doc: Adds a link tag for a favicon to the page.

argument.name: iconUrl
argument.doc: the URL of the favicon image, with the image extension indicating the image type

method.name: setHeight
method.doc: Sets the initial height of the custom dialog in Google Docs, Sheets, or Forms.

argument.name: height
argument.doc: the new height in pixels; null results in a default value

method.name: setSandboxMode
method.doc: This method now has no effect â€” previously it set the sandbox mode used for client-side scripts.

method.name: setTitle
method.doc: Sets the title of the output page.

method.name: setWidth
method.doc: Sets the initial width of a custom dialog in Google Docs, Sheets, or Forms.

argument.name: width
argument.doc: the new width in pixels; null results in a default value

method.name: setXFrameOptionsMode
method.doc: Sets the state of the page's X-Frame-Options header, which controls clickjacking prevention.

html.HtmlOutputMetaTag.name: HtmlOutputMetaTag
html.HtmlOutputMetaTag.doc: An object that represents a meta tag added to the page by calling HtmlOutput.addMetaTag(name, content).

method.name: getContent
method.doc: Gets the content of this meta tag.

method.name: getName
method.doc: Gets the name of this HtmlOutputMetaTag.

html.HtmlTemplate.name: HtmlTemplate
html.HtmlTemplate.doc: A template object for dynamically constructing HTML. For more information, see the guide to templates.

method.name: evaluate
method.doc: Evaluates this template and returns an HtmlOutput object.

method.name: getCode
method.doc: Generates a string of JavaScript code, based on the template file, that can be evaluated.

method.name: getCodeWithComments
method.doc: Generates a string of JavaScript code that can be evaluated, with each line of the code containing the original line from the template as a comment.

method.name: getRawContent
method.doc: Returns the unprocessed content of this template.

html.SandboxMode.name: SandboxMode
html.SandboxMode.doc: An enum representing the sandbox modes that can be used for client-side HtmlService scripts. These values can be accessed from HtmlService.SandboxMode, and set by calling HtmlOutput.setSandboxMode(mode).

property.name: EMULATED
property.doc: A legacy sandbox mode that emulates ECMAScript 5 strict mode using only the features available in ECMAScript 3. This mode was the default prior to February 2014. EMULATED was sunset as of December 10, 2015. All scripts attempting use EMULATED will now use IFRAME instead.

property.name: IFRAME
property.doc: A sandbox mode that uses iframe sandboxing instead of the Caja sandbox technology used by the EMULATED and NATIVE modes. This mode is the default for new scripts as of November 12, 2015 and for all scripts as of July 6, 2016. This mode imposes many fewer restrictions than the other sandbox modes and runs fastest, but does not work at all in certain older browsers, including Internet Explorer 9.

property.name: NATIVE
property.doc: A sandbox mode that is built on top of ECMAScript 5 strict mode. A sandbox mode built on top of ECMAScript 5 strict mode. This mode was sunset as of July 6, 2016. All scripts now use IFRAME mode.

html.XFrameOptionsMode.name: XFrameOptionsMode
html.XFrameOptionsMode.doc: An enum representing the X-Frame-Options modes that can be used for client-side HtmlService scripts. These values can be accessed from HtmlService.XFrameOptionsMode, and set by calling HtmlOutput.setXFrameOptionsMode(mode).

property.name: ALLOWALL
property.doc: No X-Frame-Options header will be set. This will let any site iframe the page, so the developer should implement their own protection against clickjacking.

property.name: DEFAULT
property.doc: Sets the default value for the X-Frame-Options header, which preserves normal security assumptions. If a script does not set an X-Frame-Options mode, Apps Script uses this mode as the default.
